info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 17 at 6:50AM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...AN INTENSE BAND OF LAKE EFFECT SNOW BAND WILL AFFECT PARTS OF NORTHERN ERIE COUNTY... HAZARDS...A band of intense lake effect snow which can rapidly reduce visibility to less than a quarter of a mile. This lake effect snow band is producing extremely heavy snow at the rate of 2 to 4 inches per hour in the heart of the band, with up to 5 inches per hour locally, especially closer to the lakeshore. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 643 AM EST, an intense band of lake effect snow was located from Lackawanna into the city of Buffalo and extended inland to West Seneca, Cheektowaga, Depew and Lancaster. This band will continue to very slowly progress northward through the morning hours and will be squarely across the Buffalo metro area through the morning commute. LOCATIONS IMPACTED INCLUDE... Buffalo, Cheektowaga, West Seneca, Clarence, Lackawanna, Depew, Amherst, Lancaster, Williamsville, Elma, Small Boat Harbor, Erie Basin Marina, Blasdell, Woodlawn Beach State Park, Elma Center, and Clarence Center. This includes Interstate 90 between exits 49 and 56. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this lake effect snow band. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&
